title: Christina Aguilera attends the premiere of MGM's The Addams Family with the whole familly
text:
She's been busy with her Las Vegas residency, performing at Planet Hollywood multiple times a week.

But on Sunday, Christina Aguilera walked the purple carpet at the premiere of MGM's The Addams Family at a movie theater in Los Angeles.

The 38-year-old musical icon brought fiancé Matthew Rutler along for the show as well as her two kids, Max, 11, and Summer, 5.

Busy bee: Christina Aguilera, 38, walked the purple carpet at the premiere of MGM's The Addams Family at a movie theater in Los Angeles on Sunday

Aguilera donned a floor-length black dress for the occasion, which featured a super low v-neck sewn together with crisscrossed fabric.

Her platinum blonde locks were worn down straight with short bangs that covered half the star's forehead.

The Genie in a Bottle hitmaker accessorized with silver jewelry including a number of decorative rings.

Her makeup consisted of a silver smoky eye, topped off with a pretty pink pout.

Family affair: The 38-year-old musical icon brought fiancé Matthew Rutler along for the show as well as her two kids, Max, 11, and Summer, 5

Metallic: Christina's make-up consisted of a silver smoky eye, topped off with a pretty pink pout

Vampy: Aguilera donned a floor-length black dress for the occasion, which featured a super low v-neck sewn together with crisscrossed fabric

Blondie: The Beautiful hitmaker wore her platinum blonde locks down straight with short bangs that covered half the star's forehead

Rutler, 34, wore a Jack Skellington-inspired black striped suit with a classy black bow tie.

Max and Summer look equally monochromatic in all black ensembles.

The new animated adaption of The Addams Family includes a song for Morticia Addams by Aguilera titled Haunted Heart.

Of the song, Julie Muncy writes: 'This song treats Morticia Addams for what she is: a total badass. It’s got this haunted torch song feel, as Aguilera’s voice crisply carries us through a gothic love story. This is Morticia as a loud, powerful, terrifying heroine, precisely the goth icon generations of weirdos have fallen in love with.'

This is Halloween: Rutler wore a Jack Skellington-inspired black striped suit with a classy black bow tie

Kiddos: Max and Summer look equally monochromatic in all black ensembles

The next installment of Aguilera's Xperience residency will unfold between Christmas and New Year's, with a fourth leg scheduled to run through early March of next year.

Charlize Theron, Chloë Grace Moretz and Oscar Isaac are among the celebrities giving voice to the ghoulish Addams Family in the film.

They're joined by Stranger Things' Finn Wolfhard, Nick Kroll and Snoop Dogg in the family-friendly reboot of an 80-year-old comic.

The Addams Family will be released nationwide on Friday, October 11.
